    • Constructor Detail

      • Menu

        public Menu(String title,
            int rows)
        Creates a new Menu with the given title and number of rows of slots for menu item. There are 9 slots per row.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to display at the top of the menu
        rows - The number of rows of slots for menu items

    • Method Detail

      • setMenuCloseBehaviour

        public void setMenuCloseBehaviour(MenuCloseBehaviour menuCloseBehaviour)
        Change what the menu should do when it is closed by a player. Nothing by default.
        Parameters:
        menuCloseBehaviour - The new menu closing behaviour

      • getMenuCloseBehaviour

        public MenuCloseBehaviour getMenuCloseBehaviour()
        Get the current menu closing behaviour, what the menu does when it is closed by a player.
        Returns:
        the MenuCloseBehaviour for this menu

      • setExitOnClickOutside

        public void setExitOnClickOutside(boolean exit)
        Sets whether the menu should exit on clicking outside the menu box
        Parameters:
        exit - True if the menu should close

      • addMenuItem

        public boolean addMenuItem(MenuItem item,
                           int x,
                           int y)
        Adds an item to the menu at the specified position
        Parameters:
        item - The menu item to add
        x - The column position starting from 0 at the left
        y - The row position starting from 0 at the top
        Returns:
        True if the menu item was added, false if there was already a menu item in this slot

      • addMenuItem

        public boolean addMenuItem(MenuItem item,
                           int index)
        Adds an item to the menu at the specified index, if you are more comfortable with minecraft inventory index locations
        Parameters:
        item - The menu item to add
        index - The index location to place it
        Returns:
        True if the menu item was added, false if there was already a menu item in this slot

      • removeMenuItem

        public boolean removeMenuItem(int x,
                              int y)
        Removes an existing menu item from a menu at the specified position. This can be used to create dynamic menus, however beware that if you change a menu it will change for all viewers. You should use the MenuAPI.cloneMenu method if you want a copy of a menu that can be safely changed.
        Parameters:
        x - The column position starting from 0 at the left
        y - The row position starting from 0 at the top
        Returns:
        True, if there was a menu item to remove

      • removeMenuItem

        public boolean removeMenuItem(int index)
        Removes an existing menu item from a menu at the specified slot index, if you are more comfortable with Minecraft inventory slot indices. This can be used to create dynamic menus, however beware that if you change a menu it will change for all viewers. You should use the MenuAPI.cloneMenu method if you want a copy of a menu that can be safely changed.
        Parameters:
        x - The column position starting from 0 at the left
        y - The row position starting from 0 at the top
        Returns:
        True, if there was a menu item to remove

      • openMenu

        public void openMenu(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Opens a menu for a player. Important note: This should not be used to switch from one menu to another within the same tick as there is an error with Bukkit inventories that will cause it to glitch. Instead delay 1 tick before opening or use the switchMenu method to do it for you. Be aware that if you make changes to a menu with multiple viewers it will change for all of them. You should use the MenuAPI.cloneMenu method if you want a copy of a menu that can be safely changed. Be sure to destroy it if you do not intend to use it again.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to open the menu for

      • closeMenu

        public void closeMenu(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Closes a menu for a player
        Parameters:
        player -

      • switchMenu

        public void switchMenu(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                       Menu toMenu)
        Closes this menu and opens another in the next tick. This avoids the Bukkit glitchiness caused by closing and opening inventories in the same tick.
        Parameters:
        player - The player switching menus
        toMenu - The menu to switch to

      • getInventory

        public org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory getInventory()
        Gets the inventory used by this menu. It is not recommended to access or change the inventory directly. Please use the API methods provided.
        Specified by:
        getInventory in interface org.bukkit.inventory.InventoryHolder
        Returns:
        The Inventory used to create the menu

      • exitOnClickOutside

        public boolean exitOnClickOutside()
        Determines whether this menu should close if a player clicks outside of it
        Returns:
        True, if the menu should close

      • updateMenu

        public void updateMenu()
        Updates this menu after changes are made so that viewers can instantly see them
